channel.title: CVE Feed for YugabyteDB -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for YugabyteDB -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-6002|2024-09-17T13:03:18.141Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb
item.description: YugabyteDB is vulnerable to cross site scripting (XSS) via log injection. Writing invalidated user input to log files can allow an unprivileged attacker to forge log entries or inject malicious content into the logs.

item.title: CVE-2023-6001|2024-09-17T13:03:52.610Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb%20anywhere
item.description: Prometheus metrics are available without authentication. These expose detailed and sensitive information about the YugabyteDB Anywhere environment.

item.title: CVE-2024-6895|2024-08-01T21:45:38.424Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb%20anywhere
item.description: Insufficient authentication in user account management in Yugabyte Platform allows local network attackers with a compromised user session to change critical security information without re-authentication. An attacker with user session and access to application can modify settings such as password and email without being prompted for the current password, enabling account takeover.

item.title: CVE-2024-6908|2024-08-01T21:45:38.372Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb%20anywhere
item.description: Improper privilege management in Yugabyte Platform allows authenticated admin users to escalate privileges to SuperAdmin via a crafted PUT HTTP request, potentially leading to unauthorized access to sensitive system functions and data.

item.title: CVE-2024-6908|2024-07-23T20:36:54.209Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb%20anywhere
item.description: Improper privilege management in Yugabyte Platform allows authenticated admin users to escalate privileges to SuperAdmin via a crafted PUT HTTP request, potentially leading to unauthorized access to sensitive system functions and data.

item.title: CVE-2024-6895|2024-07-19T16:48:55.230Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb%20anywhere
item.description: Insufficient authentication in user account management in Yugabyte Platform allows local network attackers with a compromised user session to change critical security information without re-authentication. An attacker with user session and access to application can modify settings such as password and email without being prompted for the current password, enabling account takeover.

item.title: CVE-2024-0006|2024-07-19T14:26:14.160Z -- yugabytedb -- yugabytedb%20anywhere
item.description: Information exposure in the logging system in Yugabyte Platform allows local attackers with access to application logs to obtain database user credentials in log files, potentially leading to unauthorized database access.
